headers.subject: Re: linux-next: Tree for July 8 (nouveau)
headers.received: (majordomo@vger.kernel.org) by vger.kernel.org via listexpand id S1756887Ab0GHVuD (ORCPT <rfc822;archive.user.51539@a.markmail.org>); Thu, 8 Jul 2010 17:50:03 -0400

from mx1.redhat.com ([209.132.183.28]:34564 "EHLO mx1.redhat.com" rhost-flags-OK-OK-OK-OK) by vger.kernel.org with ESMTP id S1756004Ab0GHVuC (ORCPT <rfc822;linux-next@vger.kernel.org>); Thu, 8 Jul 2010 17:50:02 -0400

body.para: On Thu, 2010-07-08 at 09:48 -0700, Randy Dunlap wrote:

quote.quotepara: On Thu, 8 Jul 2010 15:10:22 +1000 Stephen Rothwell wrote:
The i.MX tree mismerge has been fixed.
The omap tree gained a conflict (involving serveral files) against the arm tree.
Should nouveau depend on PCI? It has build errors when PCI is disabled:

body.para: Should be fixed in todays drm-next tree, when we moved the PCI depend from the toplevel it didn't make it into all the sublevel drivers.
body.footer: -- To unsubscribe from this list: send the line "unsubscribe linux-next" in the body of a message to majordomo@vger.kernel.org More majordomo info at http://vger.kernel.org/majordomo-info.html
